# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

2. Arcana Pack - Choose 1 of 3 Tarot cards ($4)

**Analysis:**

Looking at my recent performance:
- Two Pair has been my most played hand (7 times) at Level 3
- The last boss hand scored 3,816 chips with Two Pair
- My Odd Todd joker has been very valuable for scoring with odd-ranked cards
- Ancient Joker changes suit at end of round, currently on Hearts

With $13, I have several options:

1. **Buy Blue Joker ($5)** - This would give +104 chips right now, and chips scale well with my multiplier stack. This is a solid addition that would help with all hands.

2. **Buy Smiley Face ($4)** - +5 Mult for face cards. 

Smiley Face doesn't align with my current strategy since I'm not building around face card pairs. Blue Joker is more universally useful since it boosts all hands through chip scaling.

3. **Buy Seed Money voucher ($10)** - This increases interest cap from $5 to $10. With Ante 4 coming up, the blinds will be much harder, so having more money could be valuable long-term.

4. **Buy booster packs ($4 each)** - Could get useful playing cards or tarot cards.

5. **Reroll ($5)** - See if there are better jokers available.

6. **Save money and proceed** - Keep the $13 for future shops.

**Strategic Considerations:**

I'm leaning toward Blue Joker since it provides immediate chip value that compounds with my existing multiplier setup. Smiley Face requires consistent face card hands to justify the investment, but my recent plays have favored Two Pairs and Straights instead. The Blue Joker delivers reliable value across all hand types—adding over 1,800 chips when combined with my current multiplier—making it the stronger choice at $5. This leaves me $8 for future purchases or banking interest. I'm also weighing whether to grab an Arcana Pack for hand leveling or hold the remaining funds to maximize interest gains in later Antes, though the Seed Money voucher's long-term scaling potential is tempting despite its steep $10 cost.

The immediate chip boost from Blue Joker matters more right now. I need that power to push through Ante 4's tougher blinds rather than banking on future interest gains.
